intro: Movement is at my core—whether it's miles on the trail, lines of code, or life itself. I keep moving forward.

timeline.title: Built a House on Wheels
timeline.description: My pandemic project: converted a cargo van into a mobile home. Designed the layout, installed solar, built custom cabinetry. A year of hands-on work that became my ticket to freedom.

timeline.title: Full-Time Vanlife
timeline.description: Two years on the road, working remotely and chasing trails across the West. Flagstaff, Santa Barbara, and Estes Park became my regular haunts. This is when ultrarunning took over my life.

timeline.title: Flagstaff, AZ
timeline.description: Moved out of the van and into the mountains at 7,000 feet. Flagstaff became my first real home base in years. High altitude training, endless trails, and a brief detour to Colorado Springs in early 2024 before returning to Flag.

timeline.title: PathQuest Begins
timeline.description: Started conceptualizing and building PathQuest—a platform to track peak bagging adventures. What began as a personal project became a full-fledged app with web and mobile experiences.

timeline.title: Santa Barbara, CA
timeline.description: Current home base. Ocean trails, mountain runs, and the perfect climate for year-round training. I've loved this place ever since I arrived. Building the next generation of outdoor tech.
